channel.title: Political families of Uttar Pradesh
channel.description: Recent content on Political families of Uttar Pradesh

item.title: Families
item.description: Document History caste composition Educational institutions Document History Original Publish Date: 21 July, 2020 Updated on: 08 September, 2020 In this post we further analyse the families. We categorised them into two - declining and rising. We track down all the families started in 1970s till 2007. Then we assess their performance in the elections held after 2007. This includes 3 General elections and 2 Assembly elections.

item.title: Quality of candidates
item.description: % select(2:10,55:61, State_Name, Year,Constituency_No, Position) -- % filter(total_assets0) -- % filter(state_name == "Uttar_Pradesh") -- % filter(election_type %in% c("AE", "GE")) -- % group_by(year,constituency_no) %% mutate(dyn_con= if_else(any(dyn_cum_2 ==1),1,0)) -- % filter(year %in% c(2012,2017)) %% distinct(constituency_no,year, .keep_all = TRUE)%% select(year, constituency_name, constituency_no, dyn_con) %% arrange( constituency_no, year) -- % select(year, constituency_no, dyn_con, dyn_cum_2)%% distinct(year, constituency_no, .keep_all = TRUE) -- % filter(dyn_cum_2 ==0) -- % dplyr::select( -c(constituency_id,state, assembly_no, -- % rename( position = position_tcpd) -- % filter (year %in% c(2012,2017)) -- % group_by(dyn_con) %% filter(winner ==0) %% summarise(mean(total_assets, na.

item.title: Linkage Analysis
item.description: Document History ADR Summary Assets Crime Industry Caste MPLADS Project count and expenditure cost categories Raphael Vote dispersion Document History Original Publish Date: 23 June, 2020 Updated on: 07 September, 2020 In politics few of the players become successful in building a dynasty. Among those successful ones some of them expands their territory to multiple levels. In this post, we look at those families to see what enabled them for their expansion.

item.title: ADR Survey Analysis
item.description: Document History All India Over all rating Important issues to the constituents MP’s performance Other questions Why do you vote for a candidate? Why do you vote for a criminal candidate? Miscellanious questions UP Over all rating Important issues to the constituents MP’s performance Document History Original Publish Date: 03 July, 2020 Updated on: 03 September, 2020 In this post we analyse the performance of dynast MPs in their constituency by using a pan India survey conducted by Daksh and ADR on governance issues for the year 2013-14.

item.title: Constituency characteristics
item.description: Asher Francesca GE 2009 : 2019 Asher Asher data provides us information at the assembly constituency level for the the Indian states. Here we are using it to asses the impact of dynast rule on certain constituency characteristics. In other ways this would also be an indicator of those places where you would see prolonged rule of dynast leaders. The dependent variable corresponds to the number of years rules by a dynast ruler in a particular constituency in a 30 year period starting 1970 to 2001.

item.title: Political Characteristics Analysis
item.description: Document History Summary Margin of Victory Turnout Effective number of parties Number of candidates Turncoat Same party Incumbent Recontest Number of terms Constituency type Raphael Vote dispersion Document History Original Publish Date: 23 June, 2020 Updated on: 07 September, 2020 In this post we analyse the political characteristics of the family politicians using the TCPD elections data. We use elections data starting from 1974 to 2019.
